paper_abstract: Error control codes have extensively been applied to semiconductor memories using high density RAM chips with wide I/O data, e.g., with 8-bit or 16-bit I/O data. Recently, spotty byte errors called s-spotty byte errors are newly defined as t or fewer bits errors in a byte having length b bits, where 1 <= t < b. This paper proposes another type of spotty byte errors, i.e., m-spotty byte errors, where more than t bits errors in a byte may occur due to hit by high energetic particles. For these errors, this paper presents generalized m-spotty byte error control codes with minimum m-spotty distance d.
paper_title: A general class of m-spotty byte error control codes
